column2: KCStep, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was previously taking Lisinopril-hctz but my potassium numbers were consistently low, so my doctor switch me to the triamterene-hctz combo in hopes to increase my potassium numbers.  I have been on it for 2 weeks and developed cramps in my legs, arms and back. I am tired and thirsty more which means more trips to the bathroom and sometimes my chest feels heavy.  I have also noticed in the last 5 days my BP numbers steadily went up (from 122/74 to 137/90) and my moods have changed. I thought I had issues with the Lisinopril-hctz pill, that is nothing compared to the issues I am dealing with while taking this triamterene-hctz pill. I tried to be patient and initially consider the symptoms as part of my body adjusting to the meds, but the cramps and higher BP numbers are unbearable.  I have left a message with my doctor to discuss going back to the lisinopri-hctz.  As much I didn't like the low potassium numbers while on the lisinopril-hctz, I would rather go back to lisinopril-hctz and eat more foods high in potassium to boost my blood work numbers than take triamterene-hctz and have muscle cramps and fear that the cramps could get worse. What works for some, may not for others.

Ken, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had high blood pressure for several years.  Was taking Lisinipril which lost its effectivness over time resulting in my MD increasing the dosage.  Finally I asked for a duuretic.  The first day I lost 5 lbs of fluid and my BP was below 115/72.  BP now is below 130 almost all the time.  I do experience some drowsiness and occasional leg cramps after a long (10 mile)hike.  But I eat bananas or apples when that happens and the cramps go away. I am very relieved not only that my BP is normal but also that I don't need to be as concerned about salt and eating out as I was.

column2: rmwcm@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I used this for high BP for about 15 years with good results.  When I first started this medication, I had oily skin.  Now my skin is very dry & my lips are cracked always.  Don't know if it is due to aging process or the diuretic.  This is the only medicine I'm on.  So, I asked my doctor if I could try another medicine.  Changed to lisinopril for about 6 months until I developed constant cough, sore throat, and sinus infection.  Changed to Benacor & have been on it for 3 weeks now.  I still have cough, sinus infection, & occasional sore throat.  If this doesn't clear up soon, I'll ask my doctor to go back to triamterine.

column2: foundit, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: for 20 years i suffered from very high bp.i was on 5 yes 5 different meds this was the 6th one added when my bp was 180/120 for 2 months. A family member use this so i decided to discontinue the other 5 and only take this one. 2 weeks later my bp was 141/94. The (new)dr. was still worried i told him that, that reading was low for me. 2 weeks later when i returned my bp was 134/74 i almost fell on the floor,then i asked if the machine was broken,she took it again after my request and it came up 134/74 again, tears came to my eyes because i had just realized i could stop stressing over weather or not i was going to wake up having a heart attack or stroke. Needless to say i am very happy with this medicine.

column2: ELLIE, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Lilly Rose, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with high blood pressure seven years ago at age 51. They put me on an alpha blocker & a beta blocker. I became a near vegetable finding it difficult to function. My BP was lower but still too high. I got on a good exercise program with weights as well as swimming. I finally got off of the beta-blocker and the doctor put me on this Maxide. My blood pressure is now 118/60. I stay well hydrated and drink fresh brewed green tea, no sugar or artificial sweeteners instead of coffee and eat a very healthy diet. I dont eat any fast food and NEVER eat salt. I always have lots of energy and feel great since Ive been on this medication. As a bonus I lost another 20 pounds! I have NOT had any side effects other than if I dont stay hydrated, I have gotten leg cramps during the night.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Starting taking this medication about less than a week ago for high blood pressure. My blood pressure was 150/98, sometimes higher. About 2 days ago it went down to 123/80. After I ate a can of salty soup it went back up. Now I try to really avoid salty foods and it went back to 130/83. The only side effects I felt was weakness, dizzyiess when walking/standing, weight-loss (good in my case), going to the bathroom alot, and muscle stiffness.

column2: poofie2, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with Hypertension 1 at 29. I have been on this medication now for about 3 1/2 years. I tried to avoid being on a prescription medication for as long as I could to control my blood pressure. Hypertension runs in my family, especially on the women's side. I have always been in shape and excercise regularly and have never been overweight, but my blood pressure was just getting higher and higher and staying that way. I suffered from many headaches, migraines and fatigue. My sister had a stroke at 32 and this is what made me think twice about not being on a prescription to control my blood pressure. Not to mention my doctor was insisting on it. My "normal" blood pressure stays around 140/90. With this medication it is regulated to around 120/80. There are times that I have lapsed without taking this medication and if I do for more than a month, my blood pressure will creep back up to 140/90 and I start to feel the affects. This medication regulates my pressure very well with very few side affects once Ive been on it for a while. When I first started taking it, it took me about 3 weeks to get used to it. I experienced severe fatigue, stomach cramps, leg and arm cramps and weakness and dizziness. When I lapse for a month or more and then get back on the drug, I have to endure about a week or so of side affects like stomach cramps and fatigue. It seems as if this drug has withdrawel affects if you stop taking it cold turkey. Overall, I am satisfied with this drug. I can feel the difference physically when my blood pressure is where it should be.
